intro: Philibertia obtusiuscula, commonly known as the narrow-leaved filaree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small, annual herb that typically grows in dry, sandy soils. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, and it is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. The species is part of the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads.
